newsitem.title: JAMAICA: Jamaican economy shrank 1.7 percent in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Jamaican economy shrank 1.7 percent in 1996.

text.p: The Jamaican economy shrank by 1.7 percent in 1996, the government's statistical institute said Monday.
The economic decline was due largely to difficulties in the financial services sector and to the negative impact of last year's 12.5 pct revaluation of the local currency on local exporters.
Gross domestic product grew just 0.8 percent in 1995. The government is predicting growth of two to three percent this year. Over the last 20 years, Jamaica has averaged 0.5 percent in annual growth.
